net.asrex.skillful

Class PlayerSkillInfo

  • java.lang.Object
    • net.asrex.skillful.PlayerSkillInfo

  • public class PlayerSkillInfo
extends java.lang.Object
    Stores player skill and perk data, and handles reading and writing to the player NBT.

      • getSkillsForEvent

        public java.util.List<Skill> getSkillsForEvent(java.lang.String event)
        Gets all skills for this player that should be seeded by the given event.
        Parameters:
        event - the event to look up
        Returns:
        a list of matching skills for the given event

      • updateSkills

        public boolean updateSkills()
        Updates skills for the player, adding any missing Skill definitions that may have been added since this PlayerSkillInfo instance was created.

        Note that old skills are currently not removed from the player if they are removed from the configuration file.

        Returns:
        true if a skill was added or removed from the player, false if no changes were made

      • getActiveEffects

        public java.util.List<Effect> getActiveEffects()

      • getActiveEffects

        public <T extends Effect> java.util.List<T> getActiveEffects(java.lang.Class<T> effectClass)
        Generates a list of all active effects of the given type. Note that this only compares effect class, and will not account for different instances of the same effect class with different configured parameters.
        Type Parameters:
        T - the effect type
        Parameters:
        effectClass - the effect class to search for
        Returns:
        a list of effects of the given type

      • hasActiveEffects

        public boolean hasActiveEffects(java.lang.String perkName)
        Determines if the player has any active effects for the given perk.
        Parameters:
        perkName - the perk to search for
        Returns:
        true if at least one effect of the given perk is active, false otherwise

      • getActiveEffects

        public java.util.List<Effect> getActiveEffects(java.lang.String perkName)
        Gets all active effects provided by the given perk.
        Parameters:
        perkName - the parent perk for which to query on active effects
        Returns:
        a list of matching active effects

      • getActiveEffectsOfType

        public java.util.List<Effect> getActiveEffectsOfType(java.lang.Class<? extends EffectDefinition> definitionClass)

      • hasActiveEffect

        public boolean hasActiveEffect(java.lang.Class<? extends EffectDefinition> definitionClass)
        Determines if this player currently has an active effect of the same class as the given effect definition. Note that this only compares definition class, and will not account for different instances of the same effect class with different configured parameters.
        Parameters:
        definitionClass - the definition to search for
        Returns:
        true if an active effect of the given type exists, false if not

      • getActiveEffect

        public Effect getActiveEffect(java.lang.String perkName,
                     java.lang.String effectName)
        Gets the unique effect with the given parameters, if any matching effect is currently active on this player.
        Parameters:
        perkName - the perk name
        effectName - the effect name
        Returns:
        the matching effect if a match is found, otherwise null

      • hasActiveEffect

        public boolean hasActiveEffect(java.lang.String perkName,
                      java.lang.String effectName)

      • getActiveEffectFromSlugs

        public Effect getActiveEffectFromSlugs(java.lang.String perkSlug,
                              java.lang.String effectSlug)
        An alternative implementation of getActiveEffect(String, String) that uses slugs for querying, suitable for usage with text commands. The perkSlug and effectSlug parameters are assumed already be in "slug" form; in particular, case sensitivity is enforced and the input strings should already be all-lowercase.
        Parameters:
        perkSlug - the perk name slug to query for
        effectSlug - the effect name slug to query for
        Returns:
        a matching effect if any exists, or null
        See Also:
        TextUtil.slugify(java.lang.String), getActiveEffect(java.lang.String, java.lang.String)

      • removeActiveEffect

        public void removeActiveEffect(Effect effect)

      • addActiveEffect

        public void addActiveEffect(Effect effect)
        Adds the given effect to the player's list of active effects. Note that this will not enable the effect or propagate the changes to the client; see PlayerNetworkHelper.addAndActivateEffect(EntityPlayer, Effect) for an alternative that apply these changes.
        Parameters:
        effect - the effect to add

      • getEffectDefinition

        public EffectDefinition getEffectDefinition(java.lang.String perkName,
                                   java.lang.String effectName)
        Attempts to retrieve the effect definition with the given name, returning null if a matching perk does not exist, or if no matching effect exists within the perk.

        As Abilities are ephemeral and not stored in activeEffects, they can be checked using this method to ensure the player can execute them.

        Parameters:
        perkName - the perk containing the effect
        effectName - the name of the effect definition to retrieve
        Returns:
        the matching effect definition, or null

      • hasEffect

        public boolean hasEffect(java.lang.String perkName,
                java.lang.String effectName)
        Determines if the player has access to the given effect via the given perk.

        As Abilities are ephemeral and not stored in activeEffects, they can be checked using this method to ensure the player can execute them.

        Parameters:
        perkName - the perk containing the effect
        effectName - the name of the effect definition to retrieve
        Returns:
        true if the player has access to the given effect, false if not

      • readNBT

        public void readNBT(net.minecraft.nbt.NBTTagCompound playerData)

      • writeNBT

        public void writeNBT(net.minecraft.nbt.NBTTagCompound playerData)

      • getInfo

        public static PlayerSkillInfo getInfo(net.minecraft.entity.player.EntityPlayer player)

      • getClientInfo

        public static PlayerSkillInfo getClientInfo()
        Gets the PlayerSkillInfo for the current client player. Note that this method should only be used from the client: server-side code should make use of getInfo(EntityPlayer) instead.

        The returned PlayerSkillInfo object will be synchronized periodically with the server whenever it is updated. Note that an empty skill info object (with no set skills when they are otherwise expected) may be returned if the skill info has not yet been synchronized with the client.

        Returns:
        the client info

      • reset

        public static void reset()
